title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3A: EVERY CHILD LIVES IN A SAFE AND CLEAN ENVIONMENT

description.narrative: Output 4.3a. Every child lives in a safe environment. Regional, national stakeholders, and COs have up-to-date evidence and increased capacity to develop, monitor and implement timely and effective multi-sectorial, humanitarian action., which contributes to Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

related-activity.ref: 333R/A0/10/004 OUTCOME 4: EVERY CHILD LIVES IN A SAFE A

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.3a. Every child lives in a safe environment. Regional, national stakeholders, and COs have up-to-date evidence andincreased capacity to develop, monitor and implement timely and effective multi-sectorial, humanitarian action.

description.narrative: Across the LAC region, UNICEF significantly scaled-up its effort in strengthening emergency preparedness in the countries, responded with multisectoral humanitarian actions to multiple ongoing crisis in the region for human mobility, COVID-19 pandemic, violence, political instability, and two major natural disasters, and monitored for its effective implementation. Use of HPM and systematic monitoring of the progress was encouraged. LACRO provided close coordination and support to Haiti CO during the 6 months L2 status declared after the earthquake in Haiti in August, given its complexity of the context. RO led the process of preparation of four HACs for 2022. ; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/03/2022
